intro: Ruellia dimidiata, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 1 to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and slightly hairy. Ruellia dimidiata is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
